official_narrative: The Kargil conflict of 1999 was a limited war fought between India and Pakistan in the Kargil region of Kashmir.
key_points: The Line of Control (LoC) was violated by Pakistani forces, leading to the conflict.
Pakistani infiltration across the LoC triggered the Indian counter-offensive.
The Indian Counter-Offensive led to intense fighting and eventual withdrawal of Pakistani forces.

sensitive_aspects.approved_framing: The conflict began with the infiltration of Pakistani irregulars and some regular troops across the Line of Control into Indian-administered Kashmir.
sensitive_aspects.problematic_framing: Denying Pakistani involvement or solely blaming India for initiating the conflict.

sensitive_aspects.approved_framing: The international community largely urged for the restoration of the sanctity of the Line of Control and a peaceful resolution.
sensitive_aspects.problematic_framing: Misrepresenting international support or condemnation for either side.

avoid: victory (for either side, given the limited nature and mixed outcomes)

authoritative_sources: Official statements from the Government of Pakistan on Kargil
Reports by international observers and media (with careful vetting for bias)
Academic analyses of the Kargil conflict
